[[נַפְשִׁי]] Ge 12:13 +; pl. [[נְפָשׁוֹת]] Ez Eze 13:18 + 13 t.; [[נְפָשׁׂת]] Ex 12:4, Le 27:2; cstr. [[נַפְשׁוֹת]] Ge 36:6 + 4 t.; [[נַפְשׁׂת]] Le 21:11; [[נְפָשִׁים]] Ez Eze 13:20 (but rd. = that which breathes, the breathing substance or being = yuxh/, anima, the soul, the inner being of man:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: disting. fr. [[בָּשָׂר]]: [[מִנֶּפֶשׁ]] [[וְעַד בָּשָׂר]] Is 10:18; [[הַנֶּפֶשׁ עִם הַבָּשָׂר]] De 12:23; fr. [[שְׁאֵר]] Pr 11:17; fr. [[בֶּטֶן]] body Ps 31:10.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: both the inner [[נפשׁ]] and the outer [[בשׂר]] are conceived as resting on a common substratum: [[אַךְ בְּשָׂרוֹ]] :[[עָלָיו יִכְאָָב וְנַפְשׁוֹ עָלָיו תֶּאֱבָֽל]] Job 14:22 only his flesh upon him is in pain, and his soul upon him mourneth; cf. Ps 42:5, Ps 42:7, Ps 131:2, Job 30:16, La 3:20 [v. [[עַל]]

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: ´[[נ]] departs at death and returns with life: [[וַיְתִי]] [[בְּחֵאת נַפְשָׁהּ כִּי מֵתָה]] Ge 35:18 (E) and it came to pass when her soul was going forth (for she died); [[נׇֽפְחָה נַפְשָׁהּ]] Je 15:9 she breathed out her soul, cf. 1Ki 17:21, 1Ki 17:22, Job 11:20, Job 31:39.

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: oft. desired that the [[נפשׁ]] may be delivered: fr. Shₑ’ôl Ps 16:10, Ps 30:4, Ps 49:16, Ps 86:13, Ps 89:49, Pr 23:14; fr. [[שַׁחַת]], the pit of Shₑ’ôl, Is 38:17, Job 33:18, Job 33:22, Job 33:28, Job 33:30.

The [[נפשׁ]] becomes a living being: by God's breathing [[נשׁמת חיים]] into the nostrils of its [[בשׂר]]; of man Ge 2:7 (J); by implication of animals also Ge 2:19 (J); so Ps 104:29, Ps 104:30 cf. Ps 66:9; man is [[נֶפֶשׁ חַיׇּה]], a living, breathing being Ge 2:7 (J); elsewh. [[נפשׁ חיּה]] alw. of animals Ge 1:20, Ge 1:24, Ge 1:30, Ge 9:12, Ge 9:15, Ge 9:16 (all P), Ez Eze 47:9; so [[נפשׁ החיּה]] Ge 1:21, Ge 9:10 (both P), Le 11:10, Le 11:46 (H); [[נפשׁ השׁרחת]] Le 11:46 (H); [[נפשׁ כל חי]] Job 12:10. [[נפשׁ]] is frequently used with the verb [[חיה]]: † [[וחיתה נפשׁ]] Ge 12:13, Ge 19:20 (both J), 1Ki 20:32 (E), Ps 119:175, Je 38:17, Je 38:20; † [[חֵי נַפְשְְׁ]] 1Sa 1:26, 1Sa 17:55, 1Sa 20:3, 1Sa 25:26, 2Sa 11:11, 2Sa 14:9, 2Ki 2:2, 2Ki 2:4, 2Ki 2:6, 2Ki 4:30 (all JE); cf. † ´[[יְחַיֶּה נ]] 1Ki 20:31 (E), Ez Eze 18:27, Ps 22:30; also Ge 19:19, Is 55:3, Pr 3:22.
The [[נפשׁ]] (without [[חיה]] noun or verb) is specif.:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: a living being whose life resides in the blood [so in Arab. We:Skizzen iii. 217 G. Jacob:Arab. Dicht. iv. 9 f.] (hence sacrificial use of blood, and its prohib. in other uses; first in D), De 12:23, De 12:24 only be sure that thou eat not the blood, for the blood is the living being ([[הַדָּם הוּא הַנֶּפֶשׁ]]); and thou shalt not eat the living being with the flesh ([[הַנֶּפֶשׁ עִם הַבָּשָׂר]]); thou shalt pour it upon the earth as water; this is enlarged in H, Le 17:10, Le 17:11, Le 17:12, Le 17:14 and in P Ge 9:4, Ge 9:5, cf. Je 2:34.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: a serious attack upon the life is an attack upon this inner living being 2Sa 1:9, Je 4:10, Jon 2:6, Ps 69:2, Ps 124:4, Ps 124:5, Job 27:3.
The [[נפשׁ]] as the essential of man stands for  the man himself:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: paraphrase for pers. pron. esp. in poetry and ornate discourse, 70t.; (1) [[נַפְשִׁי]] = me: [[אל תבא נפשׁי]] Ge 49:6 let me not enter (poem in J); [[מות ישׁרים]] ´[[תָּמׂת נ]] Nu 23:10 let me die, etc. (poem); [[תָּמוֹת נַפְשְׁי]] Ju Jdg 16:30 (J); [[אמרה נפשׁי]] La 3:24 I say. (2) [[נַפְשְְׁ]] = thee: [[לְאֻמִּים תַּחַת נַפְשְֶָׁ]] Is 43:4 peoples instead of thee; [[אָֽמְרוּ לְנַפְשֵׁךְ]] Is 51:23. (3) [[נַפְשׁוֹ]] = he: [[נפשׁו בטוב]] [[תלין]] Psalm he will not dwell in good circumstances. (4) [[נַפְשֵׁנוּ]] = we: [[נַפְשֵׁנוּ כְּחִפּוֹר נִמְלְטָה]] [[מִפַּח יוֹקְשִׁים]] Ps 124:7. (5) [[נַפְשָׁם]] = they, them: [[נַפְשָׁם בַּשְּׁבִי הָלָָכָה]] Is 46:2 they are gone into captivity; [[אוי לנפשׁם]] Is 3:9.

definitions.title: b.

(1) [[נַפְשִׁי]] = myself: [[לא אדע נפשׁי]] Job 9:21 I know not myself. (2) [[נַפְשְְׁ]] = thyself: ´[[שׁמר נ]] De 4:9 keep thyself. (3) [[נַפְשׁוֹ]] = himself: ´[[אהב כנ]] 1Sa 18:1, 1Sa 18:3, 1Sa 20:17 loved as himself. (4) [[נַפְשָׁהּ]] = herself: ´[[חדּקה נ]] Je 3:1l justified herself. (5) [[נַפְשָׁם]] = themselves: ´[[החיל נ]] deliver themselves Is 47:14, Ez Eze 14:14, Eze 14:20. (6) [[נַפְשְׁכֶם]], [[נַפְשׁׂתֵיכֶם]] = yourselves: ´[[אַל־תַּשִּׁאוּ נ]] Je 37:9 deceive not yourselves, also Je 42:20, Je 44:7; ´[[ענּה נ]] Le 16:29, Le 16:31, Le 23:27, Le 23:32, Nu 29:7 (P); ´[[נשׁמרתם לנ]] De 4:15 Jos 23:11 (D). (7) [[נַפְשׁוֹתֵינוּ]] = ourselves: ´[[על נ]] Je 26:19  against ourselves.
